title: How to Fix a Washing Machine That Walks Across the Floor

steps.headline: Using a builder's level, check the level of the washer from front-to-back and side-to-side.
steps.description: Make a note of which side is out of plumb (i.e. too high or too low.)

steps.headline: Disconnect the power and turn off the taps behind the washer.
Remove the hoses from the back of the washer.
steps.description: Have a bucket handy to catch any water coming out of the hoses.

steps.headline: Have someone help you turn the washer on it's side.
steps.description: You will see the screw-in feet - these can be adjusted to level the washer.

steps.headline: Referring to your notes, make the feet shorter or longer as needed.
steps.description: You may need to turn the washer back upright and recheck a few times to get it level.

steps.headline: Once the washer is level from side to side and front to back, reconnect the hoses and plug it in.
Run a short test cycle to check that it does not "walk" anymore.

text: Using a builder's level, check the level of the washer from front-to-back and side-to-side. Make a note of which side is out of plumb (i.e. too high or too low.) Disconnect the power and turn off the taps behind the washer.  Remove the hoses from the back of the washer. Have a bucket handy to catch any water coming out of the hoses. Have someone help you turn the washer on it's side. You will see the screw-in feet - these can be adjusted to level the washer. Referring to your notes, make the feet shorter or longer as needed. You may need to turn the washer back upright and recheck a few times to get it level. Once the washer is level from side to side and front to back, reconnect the hoses and plug it in.  Run a short test cycle to check that it does not "walk" anymore.
